questions.text: Four patients present with febrile illness after animal exposure. Which of the following pairs correctly matches the disease with its shortest and longest incubation periods?

options.label: A
options.text: Shortest – Scrub typhus; Longest – Q fever

questions.text: An environmental health officer is evaluating the humidity level in a refugee shelter during a heatwave. Which of the following tools will provide accurate measurement of air humidity?
Which of the following best differentiates brucellosis from leptospirosis based on transmission?

options.label: A
options.text: Brucellosis is exclusively airborne; leptospirosis is waterborne

options.label: B
options.text: Brucellosis spreads via body fluids; leptospirosis spreads via ticks

options.label: C
options.text: Brucellosis spreads through direct contact and ingestion; leptospirosis through rat urine exposure

options.label: D
options.text: Both are primarily transmitted via insect vectors

questions.correct_answer: C. Brucellosis spreads through direct contact and ingestion; leptospirosis through rat urine exposure
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Brucellosis spreads through direct contact and ingestion; leptospirosis through rat urine exposure

questions.text: A 4-year-old child in a low-income urban area presents with multiple episodes of diarrhea and dysentery over the past month. Sanitary conditions are poor, and houseflies are abundant. Which of the following diseases is least likely transmitted by this vector?
A patient’s CBNAAT result shows Mycobacterium tuberculosis detected with rifampicin indeterminate resistance. What is the next step in management?
questions.correct_answer: C. Repeat CBNAAT on second sample
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Repeat CBNAAT on second sample

questions.text: Assertion: The SDG target is To End Preventable deaths of Newborns and Under-five children. Reason: Global MMR has to be reduced below 70 per 100,000 live births by 2030.

options.label: A
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are true, and Reason is the correct explanation

options.label: B
options.text: Both Assertion and Reason are true, but Reason is not the correct explanation

options.label: C
options.text: Assertion is true, but Reason is false

options.label: D
options.text: Assertion is false, and Reason is also false

questions.correct_answer: B. Both Assertion and Reason are true, but Reason is not the correct explanation
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Both Assertion and Reason are true, but Reason is not the correct explanation

questions.text: A 4-year-old child from a rural area in Assam (North-East India) presents with high-grade fever, chills, and vomiting. Rapid diagnostic testing confirms Plasmodium falciparum infection. The child is otherwise healthy and has no signs of severe malaria. Which of the following is the most appropriate treatment regimen and corresponding blister pack color?

options.label: A
options.text: ACT-SP for 3 days + Primaquine Day 2; Green blister pack

options.label: B
options.text: ACT-AL for 3 days + Primaquine Day 2; Yellow blister pack

options.label: C
options.text: Chloroquine for 3 days + Primaquine 14 days; Yellow blister pack

options.label: D
options.text: ACT-SP for 3 days + Primaquine Day 2; Red blister pack

questions.correct_answer: B. ACT-AL for 3 days + Primaquine Day 2; Yellow blister pack
questions.explanation: Ans. B) ACT-AL for 3 days + Primaquine Day 2; Yellow blister pack

questions.text: A government health advisor is reviewing eligibility criteria for empanelment under the AB-NHPS scheme. Which of the following correctly identifies the minimum infrastructure requirement for a private hospital to be empanelled?

A public health officer is supervising IFA tablet distribution to school-going children aged 6 years. Which of the following combinations correctly identifies the IFA dose, frequency, and tablet color for this age group?

options.label: A
options.text: 20 mg elemental iron + 100 mcg folic acid; biweekly; pink

options.label: B
options.text: 45 mg elemental iron + 400 mcg folic acid; weekly; pink

options.label: C
options.text: 60 mg elemental iron + 500 mcg folic acid; daily; red

options.label: D
options.text: 60 mg elemental iron + 500 mcg folic acid; weekly; blue

questions.correct_answer: B. 45 mg elemental iron + 400 mcg folic acid; weekly; pink
questions.explanation: Ans. B) 45 mg elemental iron + 400 mcg folic acid; weekly; pink

questions.text: A 19th-century lawyer played a pivotal role in drafting the Public Health Act of 1848 in response to unsanitary conditions and frequent cholera outbreaks in England. His advocacy laid the foundation for modern public health administration. Identify the individual?
Which of the following is a key methodological difference between HDI and MDPI?

options.label: A
options.text: HDI uses linear averaging; MDPI uses geometric mean

options.label: C
options.text: HDI measures progress; MDPI measures acute deprivation

options.label: D
options.text: HDI assesses housing quality directly; MDPI does not

questions.correct_answer: C. HDI measures progress; MDPI measures acute deprivation
questions.explanation: Ans. C) HDI measures progress; MDPI measures acute deprivation

questions.text: A disease where almost all infections become symptomatic would least likely be represented by the iceberg model. Which of the following fits this description?
Which of the following correctly matches the classification to the example: “Loss of job because of inability to perform physical tasks due to loss of limb”?
Which of the following surveillance methods is most appropriate for capturing the true morbidity of the disease?

In a cohort study between chronic mobile usage and backache development, the incidence of a disease among the exposed is equal to that among the non-exposed. What does the relative risk suggest in this case?

A population-level study is conducted to explore the association between per capita alcohol consumption and incidence of domestic violence across 20 districts in a country. Results reveal a strong positive correlation. However, further individual-level data shows no significant association. What is the most likely explanation for this discrepancy?

A researcher conducts a meta-analysis on the efficacy of a new antidiabetic drug and reports a statistically significant pooled effect size. However, several of the included studies have small sample sizes and inconsistent results/endpoints. Which of the following best describes a major limitation this analysis may face?

Which of the following statements regarding serial interval and communicability are incorrect? Serial interval is always shorter than the incubation period. The period of communicability may overlap with the incubation period in some diseases. Secondary attack rate is a proxy measure for the period of communicability. Serial interval is defined as the time gap between symptom onset in a primary case and the infection of a secondary case.
A new pediatric vaccine contains the Edmonston Zagreb strain. Which of the following statements is true regarding this vaccine?

options.label: A
options.text: It requires intradermal injection at 6 weeks of age

options.label: B
options.text: It provides >99% protection with a single dose

options.label: C
options.text: It is administered intramuscularly into the thigh

options.label: D
options.text: It must be stored between +2°C to +8°C

questions.correct_answer: D. It must be stored between +2°C to +8°C
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It must be stored between +2°C to +8°C

questions.text: A 48-year-old man undergoes testing for a chronic infectious disease. Among a large cohort of individuals confirmed to have the disease, the diagnostic test correctly identifies 92% of them. Which of the following parameters does this observation best describe?

options.label: C
options.text: Positive predictive value of the test

questions.text: Which of the following statements is most accurate regarding the measles?

options.label: A
options.text: Period of communicability is 7 days before to 2 days after symptom onset

options.label: B
options.text: Secondary attack rate is typically below 40%

options.label: C
options.text: Incubation period is usually between 10 to 14 days

options.label: D
options.text: Causative organism is a DNA virus

questions.correct_answer: C. Incubation period is usually between 10 to 14 days
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Incubation period is usually between 10 to 14 days

questions.text: A region affected by cholera reports two new cases after 10 weeks of silence. According to WHO, what is the implication for declaring the area cholera-free?

options.label: A
options.text: It cannot be declared free as cases occurred within 6 months

options.label: C
options.text: It is declared cholera-free if there are no cases for 2 incubation periods

options.label: D
options.text: It is not cholera-free until twice the incubation period has passed without new cases

questions.correct_answer: D. It is not cholera-free until twice the incubation period has passed without new cases
questions.explanation: Ans. D) It is not cholera-free until twice the incubation period has passed without new cases

questions.text: As per NAPRE (National Action Plan for Dog Mediated Rabies Elimination), what is the minimum anti-rabies vaccination coverage required among dogs in a defined area for three consecutive years?
Which of the following best explains the reason for the high number of false positives in a community setting?

options.label: A
options.text: High prevalence and low incidence of disease

options.label: B
options.text: High incidence and low prevalence of disease

options.label: C
options.text: Low prevalence and low incidence of disease

options.label: D
options.text: High incidence and high prevalence of disease

questions.correct_answer: B. High incidence and low prevalence of disease
questions.explanation: Ans. B) High incidence and low prevalence of disease

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding ROC curves are true? ROC curve plots True Positive Rate (Sensitivity) against False Positive Rate (1 - Specificity). A test with an ROC curve close to the diagonal line indicates high diagnostic accuracy. Area under the ROC curve (AUC) provides a measure of test performance, with values closer to 1 indicating better performance. ROC curve can be used to determine the optimal cut-off value of a diagnostic test.

A 6-year-old child from an endemic area presents with prolonged fever and hepatosplenomegaly. Laboratory tests show pancytopenia and rk39 is positive. Considering the most likely diagnosis, what is the key epidemiological characteristic of this infection in India?

options.label: A
options.text: Zoonotic transmission with rodents as reservoirs

options.label: B
options.text: Non-zoonotic transmission with humans as reservoirs

questions.correct_answer: B. Non-zoonotic transmission with humans as reservoirs
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Non-zoonotic transmission with humans as reservoirs

questions.text: A country reports a 4.9% prevalence of active trachoma among children under 10 years. According to WHO criteria, which of the following is the most appropriate classification for the country's trachoma status?

options.label: A
options.text: Trachoma is a notifiable public health problem

options.label: C
options.text: Elimination threshold for active trachoma met

options.label: D
options.text: Elimination only possible after trichiasis eradication

questions.correct_answer: C. Elimination threshold for active trachoma met
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Elimination threshold for active trachoma met

questions.text: Which of the following blood pressure parameters is most predictive of coronary heart disease (CHD) risk and is used for risk stratification in epidemiological studies?

A 60-year-old man with type 2 diabetes mellitus is advised to follow a diet rich in low glycaemic index (GI) foods. Which of the following food choices would most likely help in maintaining better postprandial glucose control?
A 67-year-old man has perception of light in one eye but no light perception in the other. His visual acuity in the better eye is 1/60. Which WHO category of blindness applies here?

Which of the following statements regarding cancer epidemiology are true? Breast cancer is the most common cancer globally. Environmental factors account for the majority of cancer cases. Cervical cancer is the most common cancer among Indian females. Occupational exposures contribute to less than 10% of all cancers.

Which of the following are correct regarding the Haddon Matrix? It was developed in the 1970s by Dr. William Haddon. The post-injury phase deals with primary prevention strategies. The pre-injury phase aims to reduce exposure to risk and prevent accidents. Injury-phase interventions aim to reduce energy absorption by the host.

Which of the following statements are correct regarding Zika virus disease? It is transmitted through Aedes aegypti and Aedes albopictus Vertical transmission may lead to hydrops fetalis RT-PCR is useful for diagnosis in the first 3–5 days Treatment is primarily antiviral
During performance appraisal of ASHAs, the indicator “% fever cases received chloroquine within 1 week” best reflects:
Which of the following combinations is correct regarding iodine requirements and risk of deficiency complications?

options.label: A
options.text: Adult males – 90 mcg/day – risk of mental retardation

options.label: B
options.text: Pregnant women – 150 mcg/day – risk of goitre

options.label: C
options.text: Preschool children – 90 mcg/day – risk of cretinism

options.label: D
options.text: School children – 250 mcg/day – risk of hypothyroidism

questions.correct_answer: C. Preschool children – 90 mcg/day – risk of cretinism
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Preschool children – 90 mcg/day – risk of cretinism

questions.text: A woman aged 20, delivers her second child and inquires about the PMMVY benefits. Which of the following statements correctly describes her eligibility?

options.label: A
options.text: She will receive full cash benefits after immunizing her child

options.label: B
options.text: Only first live birth is eligible for PMMVY benefits

options.label: C
options.text: Benefits are given for all pregnancies if above 19 years

options.label: D
options.text: She is not eligible due to her age

questions.correct_answer: B. Only first live birth is eligible for PMMVY benefits
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Only first live birth is eligible for PMMVY benefits

questions.text: A 26-year-old woman in her second trimester of pregnancy presents with painful nodules over her extremities, fever, and malaise. She is currently undergoing multidrug therapy for lepromatous leprosy. Examination reveals tender erythematous nodules over the arms and legs consistent with erythema nodosum leprosum (Type 2 lepra reaction). Which of the following is the most appropriate next step in management?

options.label: A
options.text: Stop leprosy drugs and add steroids

options.label: D
options.text: Continue anti-leprosy drugs and add steroids

questions.correct_answer: D. Continue anti-leprosy drugs and add steroids
questions.explanation: Ans. D) Continue anti-leprosy drugs and add steroids

questions.text: Match the following fertility and mortality indicators with their correct definitions: Column A (Indicator) Total Fertility Rate (TFR) Gross Reproduction Rate (GRR) Net Reproduction Rate (NRR) General Fertility Rate (GFR) Column B (Definition) Number of daughters born per woman, assuming she survives through reproductive age Number of live births per woman if current age-specific fertility rates apply throughout life Number of daughters born per woman without considering survival Number of live births per 1000 women aged 15–49 years

A country exhibits the following indicators: declining fertility rate, youth dependency ratio reducing, and output per capita steadily increasing. Which demographic phenomenon is best illustrated by this trend?

A 29-year-old woman is on combined OCPs and asks about their long-term protective effects against cancer. Which of the following statements best explains the cancer-protective benefits of combined OCPs?

options.label: A
options.text: Protection is limited to breast and cervical cancers only

options.label: B
options.text: Reduces the risk of ovarian cancer by 10% and endometrial cancer by 15%

options.label: C
options.text: Reduces ovarian cancer risk by 40% and endometrial cancer risk by 50%

options.label: D
options.text: Risk returns to baseline within 2 years of discontinuation

questions.correct_answer: C. Reduces ovarian cancer risk by 40% and endometrial cancer risk by 50%
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Reduces ovarian cancer risk by 40% and endometrial cancer risk by 50%

questions.text: Which of the following were part of the Renuka Roy School Health Committee recommendations? Eye screening only after age 15 Health exam at entry and every 4 years Focus on children aged 10–14 years Monthly medical examination

Which of the following statements regarding energy requirements is/are correct? Adult reference male doing heavy work requires over 3400 kcal/day. Energy requirement for first half of lactation is higher than second half for an adult female. A lactating woman in her first 6 months requires an additional 600 kcal/day. Pregnant women require more additional calories than lactating women.

Identify the correct statements: Iodine requirement increases in pregnancy and further in lactation. Vitamin D requirement is constant across all groups. The daily folate requirement for pregnancy is more than double that for men. Vitamin C requirement is highest in lactation.
Match the Following Column A (Food Item) Egg Soyabean Groundnut Cow’s Milk Column B (Approximate NPU Value) 81 96 55 50
Identify the correct descending order of iron content from highest to lowest among the listed pulses.

options.label: A
options.text: Soya Bean > Bengal Gram > Black Gram > Red Gram

options.label: B
options.text: Soya Bean > Black Gram > Bengal Gram > Red Gram

options.label: C
options.text: Soya Bean > Bengal Gram > Red Gram > Black Gram

options.label: D
options.text: Soya Bean > Red Gram > Bengal Gram > Black Gram

questions.correct_answer: C. Soya Bean > Bengal Gram > Red Gram > Black Gram
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Soya Bean > Bengal Gram > Red Gram > Black Gram

questions.text: Which of the following statements regarding Shakir’s tape and MAC interpretation is incorrect?

options.label: B
options.text: MUAC >13.5 cm is classified under green zone

options.label: C
options.text: WHO defines MUAC <11.5 cm as a cutoff for moderate malnutrition

options.label: D
options.text: Red zone management includes referral and institutional support

questions.correct_answer: C. WHO defines MUAC <11.5 cm as a cutoff for moderate malnutrition

questions.text: The term social structure refers to:

options.label: B
options.text: Patterns of inter-relationships between persons in a society

questions.correct_answer: B. Patterns of inter-relationships between persons in a society
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Patterns of inter-relationships between persons in a society

questions.text: What is the key feature distinguishing attitudes from opinions?

A researcher is conducting an SES study in a tribal village. He observes that SES classification using income alone underestimates the community's actual wealth. Which scale would be most appropriate for such an evaluation?

A large group of people temporarily gathers outside a hospital to protest against medical negligence. A few aggressive individuals incite the group to destroy public property. Which classification best describes the group’s evolution?

A public health officer is reviewing the parameters of drinking water supplied in rural and urban regions. Match the following water quality parameters with their respective WHO recommended limits: Column A (Parameter) pH Nitrates Fluoride Total Dissolved Solids (TDS) Column B (WHO Recommended Limit) < 1.0 ppm < 500 mg/L 6.5–8.5 < 45 mg/L
During field-level water treatment post-flood, the technician adds chlorine to a level of 0.5 ppm. However, testing after 1 hour reveals no residual chlorine. What is the most appropriate next step?

A newly constructed housing colony has kitchen areas with a daylight factor (DLF) of 7%. According to Indian housing illumination standards, what is the most likely consequence of this architectural design?

options.label: A
options.text: No significant effect, as the DLF is acceptable

options.label: B
options.text: Visual discomfort due to excessive brightness

options.label: C
options.text: Inadequate daylight exposure for kitchen areas

options.label: D
options.text: Decreased reflectivity due to floor surfaces

questions.correct_answer: C. Inadequate daylight exposure for kitchen areas
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Inadequate daylight exposure for kitchen areas

questions.text: A research team studying water quality identifies 0.1% solids and 99.9% water in a sample obtained from drainage pipelines in a residential colony. What is the correct classification of this waste, and what is its likely source?
questions.correct_answer: A. Sewage; Wastewater containing human excreta
questions.explanation: Ans. A) Sewage; Wastewater containing human excreta

questions.text: During a mosquito breeding site survey, larvae with siphon tubes and horizontal resting posture are found. Which of the following diseases is least likely to be transmitted by its adult mosquito species?

In a rural outbreak investigation, multiple cases of acute febrile illness with maculopapular rash and hepatomegaly are reported. The causative agent is found to be Rickettsia typhi. Which of the following best describes the type of transmission and the implicated vector?
Which of the following is most accurately matched regarding BMW treatment and the mechanism involved?

options.label: C
options.text: Plasma arc – Molecular dissociation via ionized gas

questions.correct_answer: C. Plasma arc – Molecular dissociation via ionized gas
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Plasma arc – Molecular dissociation via ionized gas

questions.text: A military setting practices "reverse triage" after a blast injury scenario. Which of the following best exemplifies this practice?

options.label: A
options.text: Prioritizing patients based on Glasgow Coma Scale

options.label: B
options.text: Stabilizing critical patients at the disaster site

options.label: C
options.text: Prioritizing soldiers with minor injuries to return to combat

options.label: D
options.text: Using S.T.A.R.T. method by emergency physicians

questions.correct_answer: C. Prioritizing soldiers with minor injuries to return to combat
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Prioritizing soldiers with minor injuries to return to combat

questions.text: Which of the following is the correct pairing of frequency and target group for periodic occupational medical examinations?
Which of the following statements regarding communication types is false?

options.label: A
options.text: Visual communication includes maps and charts

options.label: B
options.text: Two-way communication improves learning by feedback and interaction

options.label: D
options.text: Socratic method is a participatory model of communication

questions.correct_answer: C. Didactic communication promotes active dialogue
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Didactic communication promotes active dialogue

questions.text: Which of the following correctly matches the committee with its unique focus area?

options.label: B
options.text: Mukherji Committee – Creation of Village Health Guides

options.label: C
options.text: Bajaj Committee – National Medical and Health Education Policy

options.label: D
options.text: Kartar Singh Committee – Establishment of regional health units with 2,500 beds

questions.correct_answer: C. Bajaj Committee – National Medical and Health Education Policy
questions.explanation: Ans. C) Bajaj Committee – National Medical and Health Education Policy

questions.text: A health inspector is assessing a Type B PHC with a reported delivery load of >30 per month. In addition to the mandatory MBBS doctor, which of the following essential personnel must be available to manage the maternity services in compliance with government guidelines?
Which of the following most accurately represents the purpose of an OGIVE in epidemiological data analysis?

A researcher is evaluating the standard error of difference between two population means. If the sample sizes are different and variances unequal, which of the following expressions correctly applies?

A clinical trial aims to compare the mean hemoglobin levels between two independent groups—patients with iron-deficiency anemia and patients with thalassemia trait. The data follows a normal distribution. Which is the most appropriate statistical test?
A researcher is comparing anemia prevalence between four age groups using a 4×2 contingency table. The expected frequency in one of the cells is 4. Which of the following is most appropriate?

A study attempts to predict systolic blood pressure (SBP) from BMI, age, and cholesterol levels. The final regression equation is: SBP = 85 + (1.2 × BMI) + (0.8 × age) + (0.5 × cholesterol) Which of the following best describes this model?
Which of the following combinations would result in a study with the lowest statistical power?

options.label: B
options.text: Small sample size, high variability, low effect size

questions.correct_answer: B. Small sample size, high variability, low effect size
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Small sample size, high variability, low effect size

questions.text: A 38-year-old researcher is evaluating publication bias using the above funnel plot derived from a meta-analysis on antidepressant efficacy. Which of the following is the most likely explanation for this observation?

options.label: A
options.text: High statistical heterogeneity due to I² > 75%

options.label: B
options.text: Selective reporting or publication bias of small negative studies

options.label: C
options.text: Data entry error in smaller studies

options.label: D
options.text: Consistency across studies with robust methodology

questions.correct_answer: B. Selective reporting or publication bias of small negative studies
questions.explanation: Ans. B) Selective reporting or publication bias of small negative studies

questions.text: A biostatistician is evaluating heterogeneity in this meta-analysis. One study (Parsons 1988) shows an extremely wide confidence interval. Which of the following most likely explains this observation?

options.label: A
options.text: The study had the strongest effect size

options.label: B
options.text: The sample size was small, leading to low precision

options.label: C
options.text: The study is an outlier and should be excluded

options.label: D
options.text: The study's results are highly generalizable

questions.correct_answer: B. The sample size was small, leading to low precision
questions.explanation: Ans. B) The sample size was small, leading to low precision

questions.text: Most common operation done by an Ophthalmologist in district hospital:
Linoleic acid/EFA’s is maximum in:
Banana is good source of all except
Mode of transmission of Q fever is:
Which of the following is not a work of Anganwadi worker?
